context: David worked extensively with Stevan on the Intelligent Admissions module at Spark451
name: David Thompson
text:
Working with Stevan on the Intelligent Admissions module was one of the
highlights of my product management career. This was an incredibly complex
feature – we needed to automate college admission evaluation across hundreds of
institutions, each with unique criteria, while maintaining transparency and
trust from admission officers.

Stevan didn't just implement what was spec'd; he actively participated in
product design, asking probing questions that improved the final solution. His
suggestion to build a visual rule configuration system instead of code-based
rules was brilliant – it made the system accessible to non-technical
administrators and became a major selling point for Element451.

The technical execution was flawless. Stevan's scoring algorithm processed 200+
applicant properties in sub-second time, and the system handled 50K+
applications annually without issues. But what really impressed me was his focus
on user experience – he built comprehensive audit trails showing exactly why the
system recommended each action, which was crucial for gaining trust from
skeptical admission officers.

Stevan's communication skills were exceptional for an engineer. He could explain
complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and translated business
requirements into elegant technical solutions. He was always available for
questions and proactively raised concerns when he saw potential issues.

I would enthusiastically work with Stevan again and recommend him for roles
requiring both technical depth and product thinking. He's a complete engineer
who understands that great software requires both technical excellence and
solving real user problems.
title: Senior Product Manager
